content.description:
The most aesthetic looking climbs on this wall, Betty's Pillar is sure not to disappoint.  The climbing starts out up an easy corner or short curtain.  From there scramble up the steep snow slope to the base of the actual pillar.  Pick your line and fire it to the top.  There aren't many trees above the pillar so best to stop short and use a V-thread.

Ski/hike up the Yoho valley road about 3.5km until you see the routes on the right across the valley.  Betty's Pillar is the right most one and sits in the next small gully to the right of Field of Dreams/the Pillars.  Cross the river (sometimes the crux), and continue up through the trees to the base of the routes.  Total approach is about 90 minutes.
Screws

Approach: Park in the lot where the Yoho Valley (Takkakaw Falls) Road is closed. The route is visible just up and left from here. Hike up the open slopes to the route.  
  
 Route Description: Climb the nice curtain of ice in 1 long or 2 shorter pitches. Another climb just to the left is known as Silk Tassle (WI4).  
  
 Descent: Rappel off a tree with webbing at the top of the climb (takes 2 60m ropes).  
  
 Objective Hazards: Beware of avalanche hazard from above as well as on the approach slopes.

climbs.name: Field of Dreams
climbs.fa: Carlos Buhler, David Burger, Guy Lacelle:  Mar '95

content.description:
A really fun waterfall with a long pitch of steep, sustained, excellent ice, combined with the 1.5 hour ski approach make for full day out. Be aware that the Yoho River must be crossed (frozen) to approach, be careful! It's best to climb 10m up ice steps to the right and a safe belay cave. The route starts out steep and stays that way, but a few bumps and waves along the way give the forearms a break. Field of Dreams is about a 5 km ski up the Yoho Valley Road from the parking area just east of Field. The road is not maintained during the winter, but it sees a lot of ski traffic.

Leave the road and cross the river (as near as possible) when across from the route. Ski through trees and up a steep cone to the base of the route. 70 m ropes recommended, Screws for protection and cord for v-thread anchors (which may be in place).

An 80m sea of blue with a couple possible lines, getting harder as you go right. It is bordered on the left by Groveling Gully (WI3) and on the right by Iron Sliver (WI6). It has a reputation for bad ice but that seems to be true mostly of the farthest right line before the sliver



A couple km past Field of Dreams you’ll see ice in a large avalanche path and low angle ice in a clearing on a shoulder to the left. In between sits Iron Curtain. Cross the river and shwack up the trees or the avalanche path as snow conditions permit

Screws

Margarita 240m, III, WI3+ Mt. Field YNP 7-Mar-2008

FA: Fraser Sprigings & Krissy Boucher March 6, 2008

Located in Yoho National Park on Mount Field, this south facing climb can be seen from the highway as you turn onto Yoho Valley Road. Park almost immediately as the road turns to the right. Walk up the first significant gulley to the left of the avalanche slope leading to Silk Tassel. The approach takes 30min.

Climb a 60m pitch of WI2-3 to two pitons located on the right rock wall. Walk up the snow for 60m to where the gulley pinches. A short WI2 pitch will lead you to the crux pitch. A sultry 60m WI3+ pitch takes you to the top of the climb.

Descent: Rappel the route.


The base is located at 377967 (UTM NAD 83) and takes the left fork out of the main approach gulley.
Abalakov anchors and some tree options are available.

This wide flow is dwarfed by its bigger neighbor but it is a worthy climb.  Pick whatever line looks good and fire it to the top.  There is reportedly a bolted anchor about 40m up but we were unable to find it in Feb 2020.  

Ski/hike up the Yoho valley road about 3.5km until you see the routes on the right across the valley.  Cross the river (sometimes the crux), and continue up through the trees to the base of the routes.  About an hour and 20 minutes.
Screws

Approach: Park in the lot where the Yoho Valley (Takkakaw Falls) Road is closed. The route is visible just up and left from here. Hike up the open slopes to the route. 
  
 Route Description: Climb the nice curtain of ice in 1 long or 2 shorter pitches. Another climb sometimes forms just to the right and is known as Bubble Wrap Blues (WI4-5). 
  
 Descent: Rappel off a tree with webbing at the top of the climb (takes 2 60m ropes). 
  
 Objective Hazards: Beware of avalanche hazard from above as well as on the approach slopes.

Ice screws

One of the highest concentrations of ice climbs in the Canadian Rockies, this great area deserves alot more attention than it gets. Most of these climbs form fairly early in the year, but beware that the Yoho River must be crossed to reach most of the routes, and this will not be safe until it is well frozen. 
  
 Includes ice climbs along the Yoho Valley Road (AKA Takakkaw Falls Road) from the winter parking area to Takakkaw Falls. The parking lot is located down a short road just East of Field along the Trans Canada Highway, and is well signed.
